title: When is Holden Caulfield a hypocrite? - Quora
tags: The Catcher in the Rye (1951 book)

response.answer_text: Holden is a “hypocrite” when he makes up stories about himself and pretends to be someone he isn't. He constantly criticizes members of society for being “phonies” but he behaves similarly by lying to others. However, this hypocrisy is more than just an oversight on Holden’s part. It is an indictment of society, since they completely buy Holden’s lies if they're in the realm of reason. It's an example of people seeing things their own way versus how they really are.
